title: lk01sg
text:
Hi, I’m Linda K. Singagerda (aka likas).
With a background in pharmacy and a master’s degree in Clinical Pharmacology and Toxicology from ITB, my work has always revolved around bridging life sciences, data, and engineering to address real-world health challenges. I’ve contributed to improving medical data quality at an Indonesian health-tech startup, provided pharmacy services to my local community, and taught pharmacology and chemical engineering—mentoring aspiring scientific professionals along the way.
My current interests span systems biology, PK/PD modeling, computational drug design, network pharmacology, and protein structure prediction—fields I see as pivotal for advancing drug discovery and the life sciences. The goal is to translate complex knowledge into solutions that are accessible, practical, and impactful.
Collaboration excites me, especially on projects at the intersection of health technology, educational platforms, and cutting-edge research. If you’re working on something in these areas, I’d be glad to connect.


I run SyntesaMateria and UPPETI, two independent digital media platforms. SyntesaMateria focuses on science and technology, publishing curated content, exclusive articles, and educational materials for students, researchers, and a general audience. UPPETI serves as a more personal and creative outlet, where I explore philosophy, art, and reflective writing. Together, they represent complementary sides of my publishing and creative practice. More details about these platforms can be found here.
I also share digital resources, guides, and creative projects through my Gumroad page, offering content that extends and complements the work published on both platforms.

title: lk01sg
text:
Hi, I’m Linda K. Singagerda (aka likas).
With a background in pharmacy and a master’s degree in Clinical Pharmacology and Toxicology from ITB, my work has always revolved around bridging life sciences, data, and engineering to address real-world health challenges. I’ve contributed to improving medical data quality at an Indonesian health-tech startup, provided pharmacy services to my local community, and taught pharmacology and chemical engineering—mentoring aspiring scientific professionals along the way.
My current interests span systems biology, PK/PD modeling, computational drug design, network pharmacology, and protein structure prediction—fields I see as pivotal for advancing drug discovery and the life sciences. The goal is to translate complex knowledge into solutions that are accessible, practical, and impactful.
Collaboration excites me, especially on projects at the intersection of health technology, educational platforms, and cutting-edge research. If you’re working on something in these areas, I’d be glad to connect.


I run SyntesaMateria and UPPETI, two independent digital media platforms. SyntesaMateria focuses on science and technology, publishing curated content, exclusive articles, and educational materials for students, researchers, and a general audience. UPPETI serves as a more personal and creative outlet, where I explore philosophy, art, and reflective writing. Together, they represent complementary sides of my publishing and creative practice. More details about these platforms can be found here.
I also share digital resources, guides, and creative projects through my Gumroad page, offering content that extends and complements the work published on both platforms.
